definition[0]: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
example[0]: leasing and other forms of business finance
example[2]: the world of high finance (=financial activities involving very large amounts of money)
definition[1]: money provided by a bank or other institution to help buy or do something
example[3]: We need to raise finance for further research.
definition[2]: to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something
example[4]: The concerts are financed by the Arts Council.
definition[3]: money provided or lent, for example by a bank for INVESTMENT (=when money is put into buildings, equipment, etc to produce goods and services) or CONSUMPTION (=when people buy goods and services)
example[5]: The building society is Scotland’s biggest source of finance for house building.
example[6]: The European Investment Bank would provide finance for a range of activities including regional development activity.
example[7]: The next step was to obtain finance in order to start manufacturing and selling full-sized engines.
example[8]: If you are selling a larger property, which is paid for, and buying a smaller one, then you will not have to raise finance (=obtain it).
definition[4]: the management of money by countries, organizations, and people
example[9]: The appointment of a top finance executive as vice chairman suggests that finance will play a prominent role in the company’s future.
example[10]: Russia’s finance minister said he expects the ruble to stabilize soon.
definition[5]: the study of the management and use of money
example[11]: He is professor of finance at Wharton Business School.
definition[6]: the money that an organization or person has, and the way that they manage it
example[12]: Italian state finances are about the worst of any major world economy.
example[13]: The television network hired McKinsey to conduct an overall strategic review of its structure, operations and finances.
definition[7]: to give or lend money, especially a large amount of money, to pay for something
example[14]: The new company will be financed by a total of $200 million in equity and $300 million in bank debt.
